website_summaries.verdict: Exceptional value compared to other models. This powerful 30W megaphone can cover a range of up to 800 yards. Also includes music alongside the siren mode to capture attention.
pros: This extremely powerful megaphone is loud at 30W and covers an impressive 800 yards
Includes volume control for complete control of sound
Control panel is easy to use
Famous 'Ole Ole' chant included along with standard siren to capture attention
cons: Some users say it's smaller than they expected

customer_reviews.title: Can You Hear Me Now?
customer_reviews.text: I've spent months yelling for kids to wake up, take the trash out, unload the dishes. They would say they didn't hear me. This completely resolved the issue and has made my children motivated when a task needs done. They enthusiastically run to "make the noise stop" I would recommend this to anyone with children who difficulties. It's like magic.
customer_reviews.author: The Anonymous User

customer_reviews.title: Great for neighbors!
customer_reviews.text: bought this to provide commentary for my neighbors during my other neighbors' arguments. Works great! Best if they can't see you... -Steve
customer_reviews.author: spburns84

customer_reviews.title: Harass your neighbors
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for 15 bucks, can't ask for more. I use this to harass my neighbors (also friends) and I always get plenty of laughs when I break it out. The sound does not travel well against a stiff wind but on a calm day or evening projects 1000 feet, 4 houses away no problem. I'm getting the neighbors all one each for Christmas so we can have megaphone fights.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: SMALL BUT MIGHTY
customer_reviews.text: How delighted I am to finally get a megaphone that I can use with ease! It is sturdy and attractive too! Although an instruction booklet came with this item, the buttons are almost self-explanatory. Being able to speak through it, play music, and start a siren are just exactly what a person wants. I plan to keep this in my car, and when the bison are blocking the road ahead, I'll give them a siren sound! Sounds like fun, doesn't it? Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: June

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for my kid's school Carnival, and getting my kid's attention!
customer_reviews.text: I used this at my kid's school Carnival, which I was running. Loud enough to get people's attention for the pie eating contest which was great. The kids found the cheer song and started playing it non stop-- super fun... they danced around to it like crazy. (I am DYING to know what the song is saying)! Now we play the cheer song in the morning when we want to get pumped for a great day. Great quality & power for such a tiny price. Well done! TY! Also plan to use it to get my neighbor's attention when they lock their barking dogs out for hours. LOTS of uses for this little badboy.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin T

customer_reviews.title: Super Fun, Very Loud
customer_reviews.text: Ok, let's get the bad out of the way first. This product takes 4 D batteries! Ugh! Other than that it is really loud, and yes, there is a volume control, but it works differently depending on if you are talking, playing music or using the siren. I do really, really like this though. And the song is great! I bought it for a walking competition prize, and I just might have to buy myself one! So much fun!
customer_reviews.author: WAChick23

customer_reviews.title: Music button:  OH -OHOHOHOOH-BARACK OBAMA OH -OHOHOHOOH-BARACK OBAMA
customer_reviews.text: Very annoying music button that simply repeats OH -OHOHOHOOH-BARACK OBAMA OH -OHOHOHOOH-BARACK OBAMA OH -OHOHOHOOH-BARACK OBAMA OH -OHOHOHOOH-BARACK OBAMA Why in the world would any want this on a mega phone?
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: They deliver the deafening feedback that you yearn for
customer_reviews.text: If your a old disgruntled individual like me and you can’t stand the young pups across the street with their orgies and loud music then this product will come in handy. Caught my neighbors smoking the devil’s lettuce outside and I turned the police siren function of this megaphone on and the paranoia along with panic was too much for them and they retreated back into their home. I’m so thankful for this product. They also come in handy for my fellow geriatric brethren when the hearing aid batteries are running low on juice.
customer_reviews.author: Kaleb

customer_reviews.title: Too fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so we could boo from our patio at all of the Trump supporters who drive by. Also handy for asking your husband to get things when you're too lazy to get up.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewsByMe

customer_reviews.title: Defect
customer_reviews.text: The magaphone/siren/music features work really well; however; the battery compartment randomly pops open ALL the time and the batteries fall out everywhere. Considering this megaphone requires D batteries; there is nothing worse than a D sized battery, crushing your foot as it falls from nearly 5 feet up. I've resorted to duct taping the compartment shut (which isn't visually appealing).
customer_reviews.author: Desirae Webb

customer_reviews.title: Review update..
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap megaphone and will not last long if used a lot. It's small, which is nice, but very cheaply made. After 32 days it quit working. Just long enough not to be able to return it. Company sent me another megaphone for free. This one has not broken and has worked for 2 months now and is still working. Thank You for standing behind your product!
customer_reviews.author: L. C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: this megaphone is perfect in my role as a security guard. It has great volume and is small enough to tote around and not be burdensome. Takes 4 d batteries and no problem. It has a great siren feature and music for whatever. Good price and was delivered promptly.
customer_reviews.author: dennis n

customer_reviews.title: Cheap at a cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a toy and nothing more. Cheap plastic, I bought it for sound amplification and get lots of feedback screeching noise. The kind of sound one gets dragging fingernails across a chalk board. I should have known better given the cheap price. This would be OK for kids to play with but not for serious work.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Angel

customer_reviews.title: Like I said
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Poorly made. Even after removing/replacing batteries several times, it wouldn't turn on. Also, battery compartment wouldn't open without prying open with screwdriver. Like I said: JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Smith

customer_reviews.title: Yeahhhhh-Budddy!
customer_reviews.text: Yeahhhh Budddy! Perfect for those Pauly-D wannabes. Perfect for quarantine-birthday parades. Perfect for driving your neighbors crazy. Also perfect to yell at the jerk who cut you off in traffic. Has volume control with great projection. Has 2 buttons with sounds- one siren which sounds like a police car and one music to the tune of ole ole-ole-ole. It’s such a fun, versatile toy.
customer_reviews.author: 7Eight9

customer_reviews.title: Educational for kids with supervision
customer_reviews.text: I live in the countryside and watch my grandkids who are 2,4,and five. I showed them how it worked and put the volume on low and we played with it outside. They loved the music and took turns leading a parade with it on. The two year old loved this part the most. I made it educational and taught the kids about how police and firemen might use it. One of the kids would ‘be lost’ and another would use the megaphone to find him. Every once in a while I’d turn it up all the way. The music button isn’t right in that it wouldn’t turn off when you’d push it or I’d have given this a five.
customer_reviews.author: Cb

customer_reviews.title: Piece o' crap
customer_reviews.text: After multiple attempts to get this piece of crap to function, I returned it. What a waste of time and effort. You'd think quality control would be better... But I guess at $15, it's "you get what you pay for". Amazon did pay for the return.
customer_reviews.author: Red Rooster

customer_reviews.title: Reggae Air Horn NOT included..lol
customer_reviews.text: It is fun, not y0ur top of the line it has a siren but I was hoping for the horn instead you know the one THE ONE that is in like a billion songs lol but aside from that, it has a weird song that you can play... no clue what it is. A little hard to hear but nice in a kinda creepy music in the distance kinda way so if you like to annoy the people in your house or wanna just yell hello at the neighbors doing yard work get it. I would have just liked a few more options but a good buy
customer_reviews.author: Kavaltiia

customer_reviews.title: This Horn Is Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: So, I saw my neighbor with a bullhorn and I knew I had to have one. I searched Amazon and found this one, the price was good so I took the chance and ordered it. This thing is the best, I use it all the time to drive people crazy! I even took it camping recently, I had our group and other campers cracking up the whole weekend. The horn is worth he price, buy it. On another note, I had a small issue with my original shipment. Their customer service was awesome with fast response times. Took care of my issue fast.
customer_reviews.author: NG

customer_reviews.title: Oil leak?
customer_reviews.text: The horn worked fine for about 2 weeks.. Then totally stopped. We replaced the batteries but it still would not work. While changing the batteries we noticed a brownish oil seeping out around the inner seal. Not sure what that oil is but it has not worked since.
customer_reviews.author: Velvet stanga

customer_reviews.title: Must Have For Sports Games/Celabration Parades...LOUD & AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: It is a Megaphone/Bullhorn (to yell into) that has a Siren & it also plays the Ole Ole Ole (We Are The Champions) Soccer Song. Used it for my grandsons 6th Birthday pandemic parade, it was LOUD...OLE OLE OLE...& AWESOME! All the neighbors even came outside to sing & celebrate his birthday. Now, everyone wants one for their kids' soccer games & Birthday/Graduation parades. It came within 24 hrs after ordering it...I highly recommend this seller & this product. OLE! OLE! OLE! OLE!....SO MUCH FUN!
customer_reviews.author: Nona

customer_reviews.title: Great Megaphone, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: The speaker part must be close to your mouth for loudspeaker, but the music and the siren are plenty loud. There is a volume button to really increase the volume . I need this for my disabled husband when he is downstairs and I am upstairs and he needs me. I told him to just use the music or the siren. Does need 4 D batteries. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene

customer_reviews.title: Excellent white elephant gift
customer_reviews.text: The mom of the kid who stole this the final time (it was the most stolen gift during the gift exchange) wasnt too thrilled (sorry not sorry) but its gonna be a funny story & conversation piece for years to come! Its excellent quality especially for the price & super loud! Will definitely buy more in future
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Smith

customer_reviews.title: P.O.S. Not good
customer_reviews.text: This unit is cheaply made and worked 1 day and the next day when we needed it, nothing. When it worked it was only marginal, I would suggest a better unit, maybe ours was a dud...
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Not as Loud
customer_reviews.text: I like this product with the exception that it is not as loud as I want it to be without having to put my mouth right up to the microphone. Overall, it does give out a loud projection and I like the music on it. Wish it had at least three different music options, but overall a good concept to have on the item.
customer_reviews.author: Erika B

customer_reviews.title: Great megaphone - dont order the batteries suggested
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with my purchase. However, when i ordered i saw that "most people buy together" + batteries. So i assumed they were the batteries that went with the mega phone. They weren't. I got size C and i needed size Dcell batteries. Its my fault for not looking closer but why would the wrong batteries be matched up with this on the purchase page?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Matt your wife is on the phone
customer_reviews.text: I work at a local bar and with all the covid mask stuff it’s been challenging to express the importance of keeping the mask on when not drinking. I can now ever so sweetly remind people that they need to put their mask on when getting up to go the bathroom or leave the building. No more customers pretending they can’t hear me because of my mask. It’s little things like “hey bob please keep your mask on” and “Matt no one calls you the white mamba, and your wife is on the phone”
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This did not work from the first time I used it. It just makes clicking noises when I speak into it or use the siren function. I'm purchasing a Pyle megaphone. I've had success with them in the past, and Pyle is only a few dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Klopping

customer_reviews.title: Strong projection for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and another smaller bullhorn for comparison. But this one's a keeper. Strong volume and voice projection, loud siren, probably would have preferred something other than Fir Elise for the music, but I love the classical anyway. I thought there would be a variety of songs to choose from. Fits nicely in my large hand and lightweight enough to carry without much fatigue. Fits the bill for what I need; a small crowd of fifty people or less, perhaps even a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: D.T.

customer_reviews.title: Loud but needs batteries
customer_reviews.text: Very loud. I bought this to tell for my kids when they are upstairs. No one ever seems to hear me shout but they sure hear me now. Muaaahhahah. the megaphone runs on four D batteries which is ok. I wish it had a cord or something but I can live with using batteries. I use it to call the kids to dinner, etc so batteries should last a while anyways. I bet this megaphone would work great for events at the park too. Have not tried outside yet but when I do , I will update.
customer_reviews.author: JulzA

customer_reviews.title: Great for calling for help to a near deaf Significant Other
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because my S. O. is extremely hard of hearing and I need him to hear me calling from another room after I had surgery. Works well. Nice and loud. Yeah, the neighbors can probably hear me too, but that's ok. The volume control lets me call only as loudly as I need to. The cheering is fun to use too! Only problem with it is if you put it down the wrong way or it tips over, the on button can be bumped, which can run the batteries down unexpectedly. Inexpensive, but really answered my need~!
customer_reviews.author: Sea Queen

customer_reviews.title: No problem with the volume!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a 5-year old who LOVES it! (Not my child - and now the parents not necessarily my greatest admirers!) Not wise to use unless there's a big crowd or a large amount of land - it's very loud. The included sounds (music & siren) make it even more fun. But it could wake even the soundest sleeper, so definitely for outdoor use only. Works well, is easy to operate, and is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Debra A. Dinnocenzo

customer_reviews.title: Ruined weekend
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one for me and one for my best friend so we could do hoodrat stuff on the boats. Just be generally menacing to other boaters at the sandbar and embarrass our ladies. Well I got mine but his took a week to get so he didn't get to do hoodrat stuff and I had to annoy my girlfriend by myself while he took the high road. To top it off his brother got extra drunk and pissed everyone off so he came out looking stellar. But I had mine so now I am the jerk because I still did obnoxious sirens and yelling at my girl but it wasn't as funny without him.
customer_reviews.author: Chris K

customer_reviews.title: This is a cheap plastic toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very weak, cheap, plastic toy that wouldn't be audible from 80 yards, let alone 800. The price should have tipped me off. Neither the "music" nor the "siren" work. They both just make a relatively weak clicking noise. UPDATE: It turns out that some of the weakness was due to a bad battery. After replacing it, the volume was greater, and the music and siren worked properly. Adding an extra star--but still returning it!
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Sherrill

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Fantastic value
customer_reviews.text: This works better than I could have ever imagined for the price. The speaker on it is so loud. And the music and siren are hilarious. Great find for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Neighbors hate me now. Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: My upstairs neighbors were being so loud for weeks my whole family was sleep deprived. I ductapped this bad boy to the ceiling vent and blared the alarm for like 5 straight hours and they were never loud again. The cops showed up at one point and asked us to stop but we filed a noise complaint against them at the same time so that was hilarious too. This thing worked for the sole purpose I bought it for - to win.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for weekend fun, not everyday practical
customer_reviews.text: Things I like: adds great volume to my voice, has an attention-getting siren, and has a built-in “Ole-ole” World Cup-esque song. Things I don’t like: When loaded with batteries it is heavy, the clips for holding the handle and batteries In place are not strong, the weight distribution is not balanced.
customer_reviews.author: A cannon

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a storm shelter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to put in her storm shelter. We live in Oklahoma so we are prepared just in case. This provides a little extra comfort just in case you might get trapped in your shelter. You can either use the megaphone or the siren for somebody to find you.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t even work!
customer_reviews.text: Was pretty excited to get this. Put batteries in it and it didn’t even work. LED light worked to indicate it was on, but none of the sounds work nor did the voice amplification. Totally bummed because I needed it for today. Will be returning!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got it
customer_reviews.text: This is SO much fun to play with! Also to scare people. It's really loud, the siren blares and the music button is crazy loud. I think it's cool that it has different options. It's a little heavy to hold sometimes, but other then that it's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Macias

customer_reviews.title: Siren mode is good for events
customer_reviews.text: I use this to wake my kids up in the morning when I'm downstairs, and don't want to yell. It has 3 modes. Speaker mode, siren mode and music mode. The music mode is very say, you'll never use it. Siren mode is good for events. And speaker mode is nice for talking into softly and amplifying. Sweet!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Chang

customer_reviews.title: Siren Nice and Loud But Good For Little Else
customer_reviews.text: Good value for money if all you want us the siren feature. Another reviewer said it was very effective at getting her kid's attention to get them up for school, etc. However, I found it lacking in terms of projecting the human voice and the music function sounds cheap and tinny. For $14.99 you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Neil S.

customer_reviews.title: Defective Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Mine was junk. Never worked properly. Static always interfered with megaphone.
customer_reviews.author: Tony P. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great safety/emergency tool
customer_reviews.text: We live in bear country. I have successfully been able to scare off persistent Mr. Bear when he double checks our trashcan. We also take this camping for emergency. I believe it adds to our safety because it is super loud. Easy to lug around and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: From CO

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY PIEACE OF JUNK !!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on 10/3/2019 finally went to use it for our company picnic on 11/2/2019 and it didn't work and now I'm stuck with this because the return window closed on 11/2/2019 the day of my company event. I do NOT recommend this I didn't know that I only had 30 days to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Alene E.

customer_reviews.title: Met expectations loudly!
customer_reviews.text: This is very lightweight until you load it with the 4 D Batteries but it was still very manageable. Strap is a little short to hand on your shoulder but I wrapped it around my wrist instead. Worked great, siren is loud and speaker was very clear.
customer_reviews.author: mrsB

customer_reviews.title: Calling in the horses
customer_reviews.text: Great for calling in the horses. No more trudging through the back fields in all kinds of weather. So many uses for these. Will also use as alarm to warn anyone not invited on the property. Better than a warning shot.. waste of ammo.
customer_reviews.author: Jeane Illsche

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is well made, soo loud in voice mode and the siren sounds like one from police cruiser. The music mode is kinda cool..the price is a steal
customer_reviews.author: Drewski

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. Hardly any volume at all. Save your money. Might be OK as a kids toy but that’s about it.
customer_reviews.author: BillR in Maine

customer_reviews.title: Loud and Fun
customer_reviews.text: This is just as described. It has plenty of volume to be heard hundreds of yards away. The siren feature is very loud and attention getting. The song was distorted somewhat but is loud and understandable. To use it to amplify your voice you do need to have your lips almost touching the builtin microphone, but that's the way bullhorns work. Great fun!
customer_reviews.author: DFW

customer_reviews.title: not loud enough for me
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't as loud as it needed to be. We had about 70 people at a Bernie Sanders voter registration event (it's a verrrrry small town) and only the people who were within 10-15 feet of me could hear me. I'm returning and getting one with more watts. They immediately sent the paperwork to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hagen

customer_reviews.title: Great except one issue...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it is the type of microphone or the size of the grill but you practically have to be making out with this thin to get proper volume levels. If you have it close enough to floss with though it is VERY loud and does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Palindrome

customer_reviews.title: UPDATING REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: We thought we tested well. But our rally was 'blessed' with much wind and rain. That, along with traffic noise, made this megaphone almost worthless. We should have paid more and got a more powerful unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mona Lisa Walk

customer_reviews.title: Works on bears!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to scare a big black bear away from my front porch, where I keep my freezer. He got into it twice, then I put a ratchet tie-down around it so at least he wouldn't get any food. He still kept coming to try to haul away the entire 10 cubic foot freezer! I put this bullhorn on "siren" and he ran like hell!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Irons

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a cheap bullhorn to have fun with, this one works
customer_reviews.text: This thing is worth every penny you pay for it. It's nowhere near as loud as I expected. The handle is flimsy and doesn't have a trigger to pull when you talk in to it. Just an on/off button on back. The siren and music features are both loud. However, I don't know about you, but a bullhorn is for talking into not playing music. If you are looking for a cheap bullhorn to have fun with, this one works. If you need some serious volume on the speaker I'd keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Parker

customer_reviews.title: Not professional quality, but good.
customer_reviews.text: Not as loud as I'd like it but better than shouting/yelling. Have to get mouth very close to microphone to get a lot of amplification, then gets a little muffled because of the closeness. Overall a good purchase, definitely.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Geer

customer_reviews.title: Super cool, volume is weird.
customer_reviews.text: This item is great and very loud. You have to have your mouth very close or on the item to get the loudest voice though. The song that plays sounds a little distorted for me when the volume is at it's highest as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Works for us!
customer_reviews.text: This bull horn works well for what we need it for. If you're looking at all of the features, the music portion is very garbled and the black trim keeps coming off. Otherwise, we'd give it a 5 Star rating. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: lifelinx

customer_reviews.title: really crappy
customer_reviews.text: I can't even use it at half volume... it crackles out. i can't turn it up enough for my voice to carry through it. so much for walking up my teenager "easier"
customer_reviews.author: luna

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: We bought it as a joke for a family members children. The great thing is they are such great quality they are being used at a business where they are truly needed. No need to pay for super expensive these work just as well and have different noises on them as well. They are well made and were shipped quickly.
customer_reviews.author: P Gagliardi

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and it turns on, we get a red light but there is no sound no matter what I do.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Derr

customer_reviews.title: Great for group games
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our teen who leads youth in games. She loves it and it works well. The handle folds and it is compact, but definitely the batteries add some weight. Meant for small groups and not spread out over a large field, for example.
customer_reviews.author: S.B.

customer_reviews.title: you will be satisfied with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: This worked exactly as expected. If anything, it was really louder than I thought it would be- no more yelling up the staircase for the kids to come downstairs to dinner. However I had to give this 3 stars because once all the batteries are in, the back of this is a lot heavier than the front, which led to me dropping it onto the floor. It fell about 2 feet and the plastic around the hinge of the battery door broke and it can't be glued together, so I have a rubber band holding the battery door shut now. If you're very careful not to drop it, you will be satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to host a kickball game and worked very well. My only issue is that you have to out your lips right on the microphone for it to work so I don't think it is one that I would share between people.
customer_reviews.author: G Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Good investment.
customer_reviews.text: It is what I expected and what it was advertized to be but have since learned I can't use it for what I wanted which is to try and quiet the neighbor's countless dog's barking. Might find another use for it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: So many uses as such a great price
customer_reviews.text: We ordered a large quantity of bullhorns for use at a Haunted Trail that we do in October each year. For the price you can't beat these! Well constructed and love the feature of the siren/music. It takes some getting used to where all of the controls are (I kept popping the batteries out by hitting the button to open battery compartment thinking it was the on /off) but once you master that you'll have loads of fun with these well priced horns.
customer_reviews.author: alliecatz

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre Quality
customer_reviews.text: Fine as a novelty. Poor low volume sensitivity. Have to yell for low quality mic to pickup voice so what is the point? Very strong speaker. Siren and music fuctions are quite loud.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as loud as I expected but for what I paid it is okay. The only way you can get it loud enough is if you put your mouth right up to it. Do not believe the hype as to how far the voice will travel. I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Jambazian

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY METAL CONDUITS DO NOT LINE UP
customer_reviews.text: This product requires 4 D-Batteries which I bought and placed inside, the metal conduits do not line up and therefore the megaphone does not turn on it have any power. I even place papertowels between each battery to help them line up and still does not work. I will be returning both megaphones
customer_reviews.author: Cher Leann

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great neighbor fell in his pond through the woods. I don't have a loud voice. Heard someone yell for help. Was able to communicate with him. And pull out of pond before he drowned he was 80. So it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Tippy

customer_reviews.title: great for getting the kids upstairs to hear me
customer_reviews.text: we have two stories at the house and the kids can't hear me if I call them down to dinner or to help. They can hear with this. we also use it to call them downstairs to leave for school in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Starritt

customer_reviews.title: This is nice and compact and seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: This is nice and compact and seems to work well. We put in the 4 D Batteries and tested it out. It seems to work best when you make sure to put your mouth close to the speaking area. We like the siren feature, though not the music one so much. It seems to be well made and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: You are dumb if you buy this
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase! Literally the worst thing i have purchased on Amazon. Only buzzing sound, regardless of setting. Too much effort to ship back so i took it apart to see the issues. Cheaply made, faulty wiring. Looked like it had been put back together a few times
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: This thing is loud!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my son for Christmas because one of his friends had one (he's 11). This thing can be heard down the street (we live in a cul-de-sac). It has an 'alarm', plus it has a 'song' button as well that is REALLY annoying (I can still hear it in my head). The song is the loudest out of everything. This is also perfect for calling my kids home for dinner. haha We've had it for a week, and they play with it quite often and they've accidentally left it on overnight. Still the batteries are kicking so that's good news. It takes D batteries. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Katy95

customer_reviews.title: Ok for smaller events
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as loud as I was hoping for, but you get what you pay for in this case. Works well enough but feels cheap and the built in effects sound tinny and just bad. For a small gathering to gather up a rowdy crowd it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Billett

customer_reviews.title: Pass
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet and even at full volume does not elevate voice as expected. Music and siron feature are loud. Not worth the cost due to voice not being loud
customer_reviews.author: AKjos

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: Not terribly loud which is good because it's a toy for my kid. The collapsible handle seems like it won't last, but it's good enough for light use. The kid likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful
customer_reviews.text: Very useful projection to take to field sports or gym events. The song feature sounded garbled, but the siren and regular speech mode are excellent for waking up the troops. This item requires four big batteries.
customer_reviews.author: sk94

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using similar to help a guy out when away - to announce events in our community. So I decided to buy 1- & this was here for a very fair price- & it works very well ! Now we can "announce" our community in 1/2 the time !
customer_reviews.author: Greg Ward

customer_reviews.title: Loud enough
customer_reviews.text: This lil megaphone is mighty, it has a little weight to it, but is was exactly what my 80 year old cousin needed for his drive by birthday celebration.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for being heard!
customer_reviews.text: Loud and annoying! Just what I wanted!... but the red hinge on the back doesn't close well. It pops open sometimes while I'm using it and it's really hard to get it to stay closed after it opens up. It looks like the battery springs inside are too strong, and the spring for the latch that keeps the battery door closed is too weak. Other than that, a really good bullhorn.
customer_reviews.author: Wilzard

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing!! Sure gets the kids attention when they feel like ignoring mama... Also saves my voice when calling the kids in from acres away. I have it 4 stars because I hate how the handle folds up on me while in holding it
customer_reviews.author: A.S.

customer_reviews.title: Not loud enough
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I thought it would be louder than my old mini megaphone. It wasn’t. I have to yell in it which defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Nef

customer_reviews.title: We like it. Only issue
customer_reviews.text: Loud enough. We like it. Only issue, the lever holding the inside of the push lock broke when we first opened the battery compartment, bad quality of plastic material so we can't glue it back. We use a tape to hold the back piece, but dosent last. We keep on replacing tape but other than that it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Jagger

customer_reviews.title: Drives my neighbors nuts!
customer_reviews.text: Great for harassing your noisy and nosey next door neighbours. Just kidding ... but in all seriousness ... this is a really good product. We fish and this item has a really loud and long reaching sound system. If you are looking for a quality and affordable item then this is the one ... you will get some bang for your buck for sure!!
customer_reviews.author: That Girl Aly

customer_reviews.title: Can barely tell if it works
customer_reviews.text: The battery compartment of this thing is made is such a dumb way that the batteries don’t stay in place unless you tape them there or stuff the extra space with something. No batteries, no bullhorn so for the 3 seconds they were in, I heard something but honestly there’s no way I would ever repurchase this or recommend it. I barely want to give it away because I would feel bad about the hassle that I’m putting on someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Butler

customer_reviews.title: It serves the purpose!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to basically torture my upstairs neighbors early in the morning. I just put the noisemaking end flush against the ceiling & let it rip. These neighbors keep me up at night with company & partying, or at least they DID! Until I got this baby! Noisy neighbors? They will NOT like this when THEY want to sleep. Which is usually all morning!
customer_reviews.author: Patrice Welch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Worked fabulous! The grandkids loved it. We bought this for the lake, specifically for the spotter in the boat to talk to whomever is being pulled (skier, kneeboarder etc). Not only that the little ones loved running around with it the rest of the weekend,
customer_reviews.author: Sherry A, MN

customer_reviews.title: Can you hear me now.
customer_reviews.text: i got this for use around my mother who is hard of hearing.it also amplifies the phone.the music is stupid.but the siren scares the squirrel's.
customer_reviews.author: sparky

customer_reviews.title: Decent low budget megaphone
customer_reviews.text: For a budget megaphone it does pretty well. Next time I'll spring for a better one with more power, better ergonomics and a better build. Two things I don't like about this thing are the terrible battery door latch (doesn't always stay latched) and the folding handle, which is just goofy when the thing starts to fold while you're using it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Beach

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Able to carry over the noise of the group to bring attention in calling players together for instruction and directives as the coach
customer_reviews.author: Cody Plain

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: My job had a more commercial fire department/EMS level bull horn but this was a great alternative. Works and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Pleased for the price
customer_reviews.text: This works fine for me at its price point. I rather have a better music choice for that button. It does take 4 D batteries which can be expensive, but works well for my purpose as a teacher on the school playground.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle G Beck

customer_reviews.title: Croove Megaphone
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. For 25 bucks this thing is great. I work outdoors exclusively during the summer in an Amusement park, and this baby gets the job done well when I've got to rally the guests/employees or make any general announcements, even over the sounds of roaring cars and screaming patrons. One small gripe is the folding handgrip becomes loose quickly, but I can still use it folded into itself, so it's not a big deal. Saves the voice box from unnecessary strain. l May buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Gullstrand

customer_reviews.title: Great bullhorn...Great price!
customer_reviews.text: This bullhorn was everything the seller said it would be, plus it arrived in time for our event. It was easy to use, loud enough, and not too heavy. The additional shoulder strap made it always on the ready.
customer_reviews.author: L. Grabon

customer_reviews.title: You pay for what you get 🤷‍♀️ I guess 🤦🏼‍♀️
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. After reading some comments I realized they were all totally correct. It crackles really bad. The buttons don’t even work correctly. Took it straight out of the box and already was dealing with problems no thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Functional but not top quality
customer_reviews.text: I am a principal and bought this for our car rider dismissal. It's not super loud, but does have two loud sounds that can be played to get hundreds of kids to pay attention to their car number. I gave it a 3 because it doesn't lock open and the top flops down which can be annoying when you are trying to get kids into their cars at the end of a long day.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Hamm

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a good product. I've had a blast blaring this thing through the neighborhood and it also works GREAT for calling my daughter home for supper.
customer_reviews.author: leftygirl

customer_reviews.title: however I think that's just selective hearing because it sounds pretty dang loud to me
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. I bought it so my children upstairs can hear me yell for them downstairs... They still claim they can't hear me, however I think that's just selective hearing because it sounds pretty dang loud to me. I don't use it often but when I do I feel like it does its job
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Loud and definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I love this bull horn. I hadn't read the product description before buying. So I was pleasantly surprised to fine out it had a function to okay music and a siren. I will order another one for my coworker.
customer_reviews.author: S. McDaniels

feature_bullets: Made in the USA or Imported
POWERFUL - This compact bullhorn produces 30 watts of sound that have the potential to cover 800 yards!
PORTABLE - The bullhorn is extremely lightweight and has been fitted with a convenient carrying strap, making it easy to tote around
EASY TO USE - Our bullhorn operates with only 4 “D” batteries and is equipped with a user-friendly control panel.
MULTIPURPOSE - Croove's megaphone has been used by event organizers, law enforcement, fire departments and rescue teams throughout the country.
BUILT-IN SOUNDS - Unlike other megaphone bullhorns, ours offers a siren and a song
